comment: Also just because something is found on Google does not make it a fact. You can literally type in "horse with wings and you will find articles on it claiming to be true.
amr:
# ::snt Also just because something is found on Google does not make it a fact. You can literally type in "horse with wings and you will find articles on it claiming to be true.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (c / cause-01
            :ARG0 (f / find-01
                  :ARG1 (s / something)
                  :medium (c2 / company
                        :name (n / name
                              :op1 "Google")))
            :ARG1 (m2 / make-02
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 f
                  :ARG1 (f2 / fact
                        :domain (ii / it)))
            :mod (a / also))
      :snt2 (a2 / and
            :op1 (p / possible-01
                  :ARG1 (t / type-01
                        :ARG0 (y / you)
                        :ARG1 (s2 / string-entity
                              :value "horse"
                              :ARG0-of (h / have-03
                                    :ARG1 (w / wing)))
                        :manner (l / literal)))
            :op2 (f3 / find-01
                  :ARG0 y
                  :ARG1 (a3 / article
                        :topic (ii2 / it)
                        :ARG0-of (c3 / claim-01
                              :ARG1 (t2 / true-01
                                    :ARG1 a3))))))
